alert.note: Alert for Cascade; Chouteau; Eastern Teton; Fergus; Judith Basin; Meagher; Southern Rocky Mountain Front (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 17 at 6:46AM MST until December 17 at 9:00AM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations 1 to 3 inches at lower elevations, and 3 to 6 inches in the mountains. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Montana. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until Noon MST today. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 9 AM MST this morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact the Friday morning commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blowing and drifting snow will also reduce visibility.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.

area.areaDesc: Cascade; Chouteau; Eastern Teton; Fergus; Judith Basin; Meagher; Southern Rocky Mountain Front
